title: The Reversible Mark Emerges
outcome: A wall near a busy transit station becomes the focus of public fascination after dawn reveals a shifting graffiti pattern—appearing only at sunrise and sunset—which matches the schematic of Halden's original BCI prototype. Some factions claim it's vandalism, others a sign from Halden himself. The Council is divided: Innovators urge study, Directorate demands its erasure, and the Harmonists worry about myths spiraling out of control. As the artifact draws nightly crowds and feverish speculation, public trust in the BCI's origin story collapses. Oksana leaks her own reading of the design, fueling a movement for citizen oversight, while the Directorate instigates harsh crackdowns.

events.description: Dawn sunlight reveals fluctuating graffiti near the central station, an exact match for Halden's earliest BCI model. Crowds gather, drawn to the mysterious design.
Council splits over the artifact: Innovators want to analyze and replicate, Directorate demands its removal, Harmonists advocate caution.
Oksana Lintz anonymously publishes her interpretation of the schematic, suggesting a hidden safeguard for citizen oversight in the BCI’s origins.
Nightly gatherings at the wall swell. Myths spread that Halden foresaw system collapse and left warnings. Public trust in BCI legitimacy erodes rapidly.
The Directorate launches crackdowns on artifact gatherings. Calls for democratic input surge as sections of the BCI are disabled by mass protest and vandalism.
